1.question: I have an LED flashing. Do I need to call for help?
1.answer: Before you contact customer service to request for assistance, check the operating instructions of the hood in the sections "Use" and "Maintenance" to see if the flashing LED is an alarm signal of the hood, which a reset on the controls of the device can be easily turned off.

2.answer: Check if the installation was carried out according to the steps described in the instructions of the hood or ask the installer to check this. If the installation was done properly and the sound actually comes from the product, you should contact the authorized technical customer service.
2.question: The hood vibrates unusually strongly. What should I do?

3.answer: Check if the installation was carried out according to the steps described in the instructions of the hood or ask the installer to check this. If the installation was done properly and the weak suction is in fact due to a defect in the product, you should contact the authorised technical customer service.
3.question: The extraction power of the hood is too weak. What should I do?

4.question: How do I order accessories or spare parts for the hood?
4.answer: You can order accessories and spare parts in our online store [here](https://www.central-servicesuk.co.uk/new/franke-hoods). Or you can contact the technical customer service and specify the model of the hood to order all the necessary accessories and spare parts.

5.answer: In the manual you will find all the information necessary for correct installation. You can also contact one of our technical customer service centers, which are available for all questions with words and deeds. (Please note that a possible use of the technical customer service is chargeable.)
5.question: Who can I contact if I have problems with the installation?

6.question: How can I reduce the noise level of the hood if it is too high?
6.answer: The noise caused by the air that is fed in operation by the hood. We have the internal components of our hoods designed so that the air flow encounters on its way through the hood only to a few obstacles. In this way, the efficiency is increased and the noise is attenuated. An increase in noise level can be avoided effectively by the air discharge good sized lines (120 to 150 mm in diameter) are used. Contaminated or saturated filter can obstruct the air flow: Regular cleaning (or a regular exchange) of filters provides an unobstructed air flow.

7.question: What is the best way to install a cooker hood?
7.answer: The hood must be a minimum distance of 65 cm be installed on the hob. We recommend a distance of 75 cm not to exceed the hob so that the cooking vapours is still effectively extracted. Some models allow a lower minimum distance - please check the relevant Installation Instructions for your hood. The air evacuated must also be made on the hood as close as possible. Select lines with a diameter of 150 mm (but not less than 120 mm) which is not longer than 3-4 m and have a maximum of two changes in direction. WARNING: The warranty does not cover damage caused by failure to observe the minimum safety distances.

8.answer: Most models can be installed in either mode, however the best method is that the hood is ducted out of an exterior wall, since it is the most effective, safest and quietest solution.
8.question: Is it better to fit a cooker hood ducted out of an exterior wall, or in recirculatory mode with charcoal filters?

9.question: How do I determine which model of hood it is?
9.answer: The model of the hood is indicated on the label on the product (to be able to see the type label, remove the metal mesh filter). The corresponding numerical code at the top right, consists of 7 or 9 digits, starting with 63 ... or 10-digit format 110.xxxx.xxx.

10.question: Why does the technical customer service not deal with aesthetic defects?
10.answer: Aesthetic defects must be rejected immediately by the installer during the installation or on opening the package the hood. Later complaints can not be accepted as warranty claims and any support from the technical customer service takes place outside the guarantee.

11.question: What is the best way to clean a cooker hood?
11.answer: Simply use a soft cloth and a neutral, chlorine-free detergent such asÂ Franke Cooker Hood Cleaner. Thanks to its professional formulation, Franke Kitchen Care cooker hood cleaner effectively eliminates grease deposits and odours from your cooker hood, ensuring perfect cleanliness inside and out. You can purchase this productÂ [here](https://www.central-servicesuk.co.uk/new/care-and-repair/cooker-hood-cleaner-250-ml).

12.question: What is the purpose of the filters? How often do I need to replace them?
12.answer: Filters are an integral part of the hood and its maintenance affect the efficiency, safety and noise level of the hood off. Anti-grease filters protect the engine from fat contained in sucked by the hood extractor. The metal filter of Franke hoods ensure a high deposition rate of fat particles. In order to obtain the efficiency of the filter, it should be cleaned every two months by hand or in the dishwasher on average. That may be used in many older models synthetic filters, can not be washed and should be replaced about every two months when fat has accumulated in them. The odor filters are activated carbon cartridges, which are used exclusively in the filter variant of hoods. You are not washable and must periodically - to be replaced - on average every three months.

13.answer: A pipe diameter of 150 mm. This diameter is ideal for hoods with an extraction capacity of 300 cubic meters per hour and more. If it is not possible to install such a line, a 120 mm diameter line is recommended. Pipes with smaller diameter have a negative impact on the flow and noise level of the hood. Ducting can be purchased on this portal.
13.question: Which ducting offers the best performance extraction?

1.question: Why should I use Franke Accesssories?
1.answer: Franke accessories can help keep your kitchen and prep area clean and organised, adding to the enjoyment of food preparation. Greater efficiency in your efforts is the result of the customisation of the chopping boards, strainer bowls etc to each unique sink's design.

All Franke sinks are available as right-hand or left-hand drainer - where a sink is only available in one format this is always specified on the Specification Sheet and in our brochure. Reversible sinks automatically offer that choice.
1.question: Are all sinks available in left hand and right hand drainer format?

2.answer: Generally you will need to purchase a Siphon I, II or III part plumbing kit (depending on the number of sink bowls) when ordering your sink with your retailer. For more information on Franke Siphon Plumbing KitsÂ [click here](https://www.franke.com/gb/en/hs/expertise/special-features/details-that-make-the-difference.html).
2.question: Are plumbing kits included?

3.answer:
Yes. Any sink that has a 3 1/2â€œÂ waste (90mm) is capable of having a waste disposal unit connected. For Franke ceramic sinks an Extended Flange is available for Continuous Feed models.Â If your sink has an overflow you may need to purchase a WDU Overflow Converter, available from ourÂ [service agents](https://www.central-servicesuk.co.uk/new/wdu-overflow-connector).
You can view videos on Franke Waste Disposal Units on ourÂ [YouTube/UKFranke](http://www.youtube.com/UKFranke)Â channel.
3.question: Can I fit a Waste Disposal Unit in my Franke sink?

4.question: How do I clean the overflow?
4.answer: Many Franke sinks come with a Hygienic Overflow, which offers versatility for cleaning. Simple removal of the logo plate reveals the overflow aperture for easy, hygienic cleaning.Â Most Franke sinks have rigid overflow pipes and can be cleaned by pouring boiling water into them. Alternatively use a proprietary cleaner.

5.question: How do I apply earthing to a Franke sink?
5.answer: Despite any regulatory enforcement, in common with many sink manufacturers Franke make provision for a mechanical bond to be made to inset sink models. This is often done by utilising one of the cut-out points for the clips along the length of the clip rail. In the case of sliding clips Franke make a hole at the end of the clip rail length where the bond can be accommodated.

6.answer: This depends on the worktop but we would recommend that you seek professional advice.Â A template and fixing clips are provided in the box.Â Some circumstances may allow for fitting a bowl directly to the worktop. Alternatively a plywood template can be made to the size of the sink, which will effectively 'sandwich' the sink flange, when addressed to the underside of the material.Â We would recommend the use of a sealant between the flange of the sink and the worktop to avoid any water ingress.Â In all cases you are advised to consult your supplier.
6.question: How do I fit undermounted sinks?

7.question: I am thinking of installing an inset stainless steel sink into a solid surface worktop, is there anything I need to consider?
7.answer: You should take into consideration the position of the overflow in the sink, as your worktop fabricator may need to router out the worktop material to accommodate it. Call ourÂ [Consumer Care team](https://www.franke.com/gb/en/hs/support/customer-service.html)Â and we can advise you.

8.answer:
Franke sinks come with a 50 year guarantee against manufacturing defect.Â 
For more information on Franke GuaranteesÂ [click here](https://www.franke.com/gb/en/hs/support/after-sales-service/guarantees-page.html).Â 
To enable us to process a guarantee claim, please ensure you provide us with the following information to avoid any unnecessary delay:
- Full Contact Name, Address and Telephone Number
- Proof of Purchase (please attach to email)
- Photographs showing full product and detail shots showing problem
Please complete the relevant form with this informationÂ [here](https://www.franke.com/gb/en/ks/support/customer-service.html).
8.question: What is the guarantee on Franke sinks? How do I make a claim under the guarantee?

9.question: Should I use a plastic washing up bowl with my Franke sink?
9.answer: We would always recommend that you avoid the use of a plastic washing up bowl as this will over time cause the development of regular abrasion marks over the sink's surface.

10.question: Where can I see a colour sample of a sink?
10.answer: Normally at your local retailer, however if you have difficulty, swatches exist for colour matching. For this service contact our Consumer Care team at Franke UK,Â [click here](https://www.franke.com/gb/en/hs/support/customer-service.html).

12.answer: No. Stainless Steel will always scratch (whether it be of Franke's manufacture or competitor) and because of the directional polishing marks on many Franke models the scratching will show up quite dramatically initially. However, with use and cleaning using a proprietary cleaner such asÂ Franke Stainless Steel CleanerÂ which you can purchaseÂ [here](https://www.central-servicesuk.co.uk/new/care-and-repair/stainless-steel-sink-cleaner-200-ml)) the stainless steel will eventually build up a patina over the years and the scratching marks will not be as evident. For more information on cleaning Stainless Steel sinks pleaseÂ [click here](https://www.franke.com/gb/en/hs/expertise/how-to-clean-kitchen-sink.html).
12.question: Can I stop my stainless steel sink scratching?

13.answer:
Franke Stainless Steel CleanerÂ is recommended for regular maintenance of stainless steel sinks.Â This cleaner is easy to apply; just spread a small amount on a damp cloth, and distribute it throughout the sink with minor circular motions. Leave to work for a few moments and rinse with clean water. Afterwards, polish with a dry cloth - theÂ Franke Microfiber ClothÂ is ideal. You can purchase both these products [here](https://www.central-servicesuk.co.uk/new/care-and-repair).
You can view a video of how to clean your Franke stainless steel sink on ourÂ [YouTube/UKFranke](http://www.youtube.com/UKFranke)Â channel.
13.question: What's the best product to use to maintain my stainless steel sink?

14.question: How can I remove 'rust spots' from my new stainless steel sink?
14.answer:
Your sink is made from high quality 18/10Â chrome nickel steel. That means itâ€™sÂ metallurgically incapable of rusting or corrodingÂ in normal household conditions. If rust andÂ corrosion problems do occur, tiny iron particlesÂ deposited on the surface will be the culprit.Â These either come from the water supply or areÂ left behind by wire scouring pads or utensils.Â Itâ€™s essential to clean off these filings and dryÂ the sink thoroughly afterwards. If you let themÂ stick around, theyâ€™ll cause rust.Â Â 
If you want to remove any rust stains from your products, we recommend using a cleaning agent containing oxalic acid (e.g. Bar Keepers FriendÂ®). Always use mild, non-abrasive cleaning agents such asÂ Franke Stainless Steel Sink CleanerÂ to remove stubborn stains from your stainless steel and make sure you thoroughly rinse away any cleaning liquids once finished. Oh, one more thing, when cleaning your stainless steel,Â NEVER USE STEEL WOOL PADS. We, and our stainless steel, thank you in advance.
We would point out that unless the particles are completely removed they will return. It is therefore very important that after cleaning the sink, it is dried thoroughly - aÂ Franke Microfiber ClothÂ is ideal. This process needs to continue until the problem disappears.Â The problem is sometimes particularly obstinate to remove and it may take several attempts to restore the sink to its pristine condition.
Both Franke products can be purchased [here](https://www.central-servicesuk.co.uk/new/care-and-repair).

15.question: How do I best clean my Stainless Steel sink?
15.answer: Discoloration and most marks on stainless steel are caused by water-borne deposits clinging to its surface. One of the best ways to keep your stainless steel sink in pristine condition is to clean it with a product such asÂ Franke Stainless Steel Cleaner, which can be purchased [here](https://www.central-servicesuk.co.uk/new/care-and-repair).

16.answer: As a general guide, cut inside the overall frame dimension (by inverting the sink on the worktop) by 8mm all round and always use a 20mm (important!) radius at the corners. Cut out sizes are shown on the specification sheet for each sink. If a template is provided, please use that.
16.question: How do I find out what cut-out dimensions are necessary for my Franke stainless steel sink?

18.answer:
The 3 basic measurements for comparing sink sizes are:
- Depth â€“ distance from the top of the rim to the bottom of the sink next to the waste
- Taper â€“ inward slope of each side of the sink from rim to bottom
- Radius â€“ measure of the bowlâ€™s corners & bottoms where the sides and bottom meet
The deeper the bowl, the straighter the slope and the tighter (smaller) the radius, the more capacity there is in the sink.
18.question: How do you determine the capacity of the sink?

20.question: How do I knock out a taphole in a Fragranite inset sink?
20.answer:
OPTION 1
If you have a coloured dot on the front face of the sink, knock out the taphole as follows:Â 
- Ensure colour sticker is in centre of pre-formed taphole.
- Take sink out of box and rest the sink vertically against your legs with the face of the sink facing outwards and ensuring the taphole is for the correct hand drainer (take care not to damage the edge of the sink in the process).
- Take a centre punch and place on the centre of the colour sticker.
- Strike the punch hard with a hammer - this will result in the core of the tap hole being knocked out.
- Finish off using the ball of the hammer and using a round file.
OPTION 2
If there is NO coloured dot on the front face of the sink, use the hole drill bit provided (FUNÂ 112.0473.656) which is stuck to the back of the drainer next to the sink bowl. Drill out the taphole FROM THE BACK OF THE SINK.

21.answer: For day-to-day care, all you need is water and a damp cloth such as aÂ Franke Microfiber Cloth. A fast and easy way to remove water marks, grease or soap scum deposits, is withÂ Franke Coloured Sink Cleaner, or with a proprietary bathroom cleaner such as Ajax or Flash liquid spray, or similar products found in your supermarket. Franke cleaning products can be purchased [here](https://www.central-servicesuk.co.uk/new/care-and-repair).
21.question: How do I best clean my Ceramic Sink?

22.answer:
Only drill Tap hole FROM TOP FACE
1\. Decide on the pre- punched tap holes you require.
2\. Measure to find the centre of the pre- punched tap hole required and cover the area with masking tape.
3\. Using a centre punch, crack the glaze in the centre of the required hole.
4\. Using a No. 8 masonry drill, carefully drill a small pilot hole from the top. NB. Only drill one small hole
5\. You can then proceed to enlarge the hole to the required size by carefully using your hammer with the centrepunch.
22.question: How do I knock out a taphole in a Ceramic inset sink?

23.question: How do I best clean my Tectonite Sink?
23.answer: Due to its unique coating, Tectonite sinks are resistant to all common liquids etc that are used in the kitchen (tomato sauce, vinegar, red wine etc.). The sink can be cleaned usingÂ Franke Coloured Sink Cleaner and a sponge or cloth. Franke cleaning products can be purchased [here](https://www.central-servicesuk.co.uk/new/care-and-repair).

24.question: What is Tectonite?

25.question: How heat resistant is Tectonite?
25.answer: Tectonite can withstand temperatures of up to 300Â°C. Despite the fact that Tectonite is very heat resistant we always advise to use a coaster when putting a hot pan on the sink.

1.question: Where can I buy spare parts for my hob?
1.answer: Franke genuine spare parts are provided by our service agents.

2.answer: For in guarantee and out of guarantee repairs please contactÂ our service agents.
2.question: I have a problem with my Franke hob, how can I get it repaired?

11.question: Why does my induction hob cooking zone not activate when using a small pan?
11.answer: Induction cooking hobs require the cooking pot or saucepan to have a diameter bigger than a certain dimension, which is specified on the product instruction booklet.

12.question: How does an induction hob work?
12.answer: The induction hob operates by means of a magnetic field that generates heat on the bottom of the pot when the latter is placed in contact with the surface of the plane. The pot used on this type of cooking stove must be made of special material containing iron and its bottom must be smooth for optimum yield of the inducer. Non-magnetic, aluminum or copper stainless steel pans as well as terracotta or ceramic pans are not suitable for use with induction.

13.answer: The great benefit of an induction hob is fast cooking times. For example, boiling water for making pasta is much quicker than using a gas hob. Other benefits include theÂ easy to cleanÂ flat glass surface.Â Another important factor is the digital touch controls forÂ maximum safetyÂ and theÂ various customisable cooking zone options.
13.question: What are the benefits of using an induction hob?

14.answer: We advise you to clean your hob when the surface is still warm and the residual heat indicator lamps are off. Firstly, use a scraper to remove any food residue, taking care not to scratch the surface of the glass; then rinse with water and dry well with a clean cloth. We then recommend the use ofÂ Franke Hob CleanerÂ which can be purchasedÂ [here](https://www.central-servicesuk.co.uk/new/care-and-repair/hob-cleaner-250-ml), this product effectively removes dirt and burnt-on food from your hob, ensuring thorough cleanliness and care.
14.question: What is the best way to clean the surface of an induction hob?

16.answer: The bridging function allows two individual cooking zones to be switched on and adjusted together. Ensure that the power is switched on and simply press in the middle of the power scale of each zone simultaneously, this will show a"[" on one side and "]" on the other to signify the zones are bridged.
16.question: I want to use a pan that is larger than one zone. How do I activate the bridging zone function?

17.answer: It is normal for the hob to produce humming sounds when boiling or cooking. Different types of cookware may produce slight sounds such as buzzes or hums. Lighter weight stainless steel pans produce more noise than heavier pans, like enameled cast iron.
17.question: My hob makes a buzzing noise when in use? Is this normal?

1.answer: Modern kitchen taps, regardless of material and design, will last a very long time if properly cared for. Do not clean taps with scouring agents or other aggressive cleaners. A soft cloth moistened with warm water is usually completely sufficient. Solid stainless steel is usually the most resistant.
1.question: Are all taps equally durable regardless of material and design?

1.answer: Spare parts are essential replacement parts for your product. Accessories are function-enhancing attachments or add-ons without which a product can still operate normally.
1.question: What is the difference between a spare part and an accessory?

2.question: How do I find the right spare part for my product?
2.answer: To make sure you find the right spare part, we recommend to first identify the product. We will then list all spare parts available for that specifically selected product. As an alternative, you can go directly to the page listing all spare parts, and, using our advanced filtering options, narrow down the results to find your specific spare part.

3.answer: If you can't find or select the part you require, it's because the item is unavailable. Please contact our Customer Service team via the Contact Us form.

4.question: Does the Franke Partner Portal offer international delivery?
4.answer: No. Orders can only be delivered in the country where the order was placed.
